title: System can be shut down without savefile warnings
OB: When a WSWB session is open with a dirty .txt file, shutting down Windows will cause the loss of the changes in the .txt file.
EB: Currently, when shutting down Windows while having a WSWB session open with a dirty .txt file, there is no warning message to give users a chance to save their changes.
SR: To reproduce the issue: start WSWB and create a new project, then create a text file in the project and add a line of text to it. Notice that the text file is marked as a dirty file. Next, left click on the Windows Start menu and select the 'Shut Down…' command to shutdown/reboot the computer. The result is that there is no warning or question message box, and the computer is shut down/rebooted immediately. This behavior is different from other Windows programs like Word or Outlook.
